NSData(NDResourceFork)

Category of NSData fro creating NSData instances from the contents resource.

Extends Class: NSData
Declared In: NDResourceFork

Discussion

The main benifit of theses methods over the equivelent methods of NDResourceFork is these methods create autoreased NSData instances without leaving any resources forks open by leaving any autoreleased NDResourceFork forks open.


Methods

+dataWithResourceForkContentsOfFile:type:Id:

Create a NSData instance.

+dataWithResourceForkContentsOfFile:type:named:

Create a NSData instance.

+dataWithResourceForkContentsOfURL:type:Id:

Create a NSData instance.

+dataWithResourceForkContentsOfURL:type:named:

Create a NSData instance.

-writeToResourceForkFile:type:Id:name:

write a NSData instance to a resource fork.

-writeToResourceForkURL:type:Id:name:

write a NSData instance to a resource fork.

dataWithResourceForkContentsOfFile:type:Id:

Create a NSData instance. 

+ (NSData *)dataWithResourceForkContentsOfFile:(NSString *)path 
        type:(ResType)type Id:(ResID)ID;
Parameters
path

<#disc#>

type

The resource type of the resource which you wish to read data.

ID

An integer that uniquely identifies the resource which you wish to read data.

Return Value

<#result#>

Discussion

<#Discussion#>

dataWithResourceForkContentsOfFile:type:named:

Create a NSData instance. 

+ (NSData *)dataWithResourceForkContentsOfFile:(NSString *)path 
        type:(ResType)type named:(NSString *)name;
Parameters
path

<#disc#>

type

The resource type of the resource which you wish to read data.

name

A name that uniquely identifies the resource which you wish to read data. Strings passed in this parameter are case-sensitive.

Return Value

<#result#>
